alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 27 at 6:41PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Northwest Avalanche Center. ..The Northwest Avalanche Center in Seattle has issued an Avalanche Warning... * WHAT...High avalanche danger is forecast Saturday night and Sunday at all elevations. * WHERE...The Cascade Mountains of Western Okanogan County and surrounding foothills. This includes avalanche terrain from the Canadian border and south to Lake Chelan including the Washington Pass area and the Methow Valley. * WHEN...In effect from 18:00 PST Sat Jan 27th through 18:00 PST Sun Jan 28th. * IMPACTS...Warming temperatures and rain on a weak snowpack will create very dangerous conditions. Wet avalanches could be very large and destructive and run into lower elevations from overhead terrain. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Avoid all avalanche terrain and stay well out from under slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Consult https://www.nwac.us/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
